['', 'Driving product strategy: This is an opportunity to work with EVERY part of Facebook Inc, from the newest, shiniest products like Reels and Rooms, to the most important topics like supporting small businesses, COVID and election integrity. You can bring the data to drive our next big product, innovation or service to our community', 'Bringing your passion and vision: We want you to come and do the best work of your career. That means driving progress on the topics you believe in, with the data to prove your hypotheses, so this space intentionally left blank', 'MS degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, operations research, econometrics, computer science, applied mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering) or equivalent experience8+ years experience doing quantitative product analysisExperience with statistics, experimentation and modelling to get meaningful signals from noisy data (e.g., Python, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, SAS, R, MATLAB)Experience extracting and manipulating large datasets with SQL, Presto, Spark, etc.Experience influencing product strategy through data-centric presentations to product, business, and other stakeholdersExperience influencing cross functional partners and work across teams', 'Providing insights on topics that are important but fall between team responsibilities', 'Surfacing and understanding cross-app effects and external/emergent trends in depthProviding insights on topics that are important but fall between team responsibilitiesSetting up and communicating best practices and data foundations for family analysisDriving product strategy: This is an opportunity to work with EVERY part of Facebook Inc, from the newest, shiniest products like Reels and Rooms, to the most important topics like supporting small businesses, COVID and election integrity. You can bring the data to drive our next big product, innovation or service to our communityEnhancing Family Experimentation: Experimentation in this area is fundamentally challenging and critical to our long term success at growing the family of apps. Specifically, you’ll help us figure out how to handle cross-app effects & network effects and provide clarity to drive decisions on complex systemsBringing your passion and vision: We want you to come and do the best work of your career. That means driving progress on the topics you believe in, with the data to prove your hypotheses, so this space intentionally left blank', 'Experience extracting and manipulating large datasets with SQL, Presto, Spark, etc.', 'Experience influencing cross functional partners and work across teams', 'MS degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, operations research, econometrics, computer science, applied mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering) or equivalent experience', '8+ years experience doing quantitative product analysis', 'Setting up and communicating best practices and data foundations for family analysis', 'Surfacing and understanding cross-app effects and external/emergent trends in depth', 'Enhancing Family Experimentation: Experimentation in this area is fundamentally challenging and critical to our long term success at growing the family of apps. Specifically, you’ll help us figure out how to handle cross-app effects & network effects and provide clarity to drive decisions on complex systems', 'Experience with statistics, experimentation and modelling to get meaningful signals from noisy data (e.g., Python, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, SAS, R, MATLAB)', 'Experience influencing product strategy through data-centric presentations to product, business, and other stakeholders']

job_title: Research Scientist, Demography and Survey Sciences
job_text: ['', 'Experience communicating analyses and results to any audienceMaster’s or Ph.D. in the social sciences (e.g., Economics, Political Science, Sociology, Psychology, Communication), or in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Informatics, Econometrics) with experience answering social questionsKnowledge in data manipulation and analysis software and programming languages (R/Stata, SQL/Hive)Knowledge in quantitative and survey research methodologies (e.g., bias correction for surveys, survey sampling and design, regression modeling, causal inference with a survey outcome, shrinkage and regularization, designing and analyzing longitudinal panel surveys, behavioral data analysis)', 'Develop novel approaches where traditional methods won’t do', 'Knowledge in data manipulation and analysis software and programming languages (R/Stata, SQL/Hive)', 'Experience with Unix, Python, and large datasets (> 1TB)', 'Provide teams with usable measurement strategies and methodologies to meet their product and business decision needs', 'Experience communicating analyses and results to any audience', 'Collaborate with product teams to define relevant questions about survey methodology and quantitative measurement', 'Help shape the research agenda and drive research projects from end-to-endCollaborate with product teams to define relevant questions about survey methodology and quantitative measurementDeploy appropriate quantitative methodologies to answer those questionsDevelop novel approaches where traditional methods won’t doProvide teams with usable measurement strategies and methodologies to meet their product and business decision needsDeliver insights and recommendations clearly to relevant audiences', 'Deploy appropriate quantitative methodologies to answer those questions', 'Master’s or Ph.D. in the social sciences (e.g., Economics, Political Science, Sociology, Psychology, Communication), or in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Informatics, Econometrics) with experience answering social questions', 'Deliver insights and recommendations clearly to relevant audiences', 'Help shape the research agenda and drive research projects from end-to-end', 'Knowledge in quantitative and survey research methodologies (e.g., bias correction for surveys, survey sampling and design, regression modeling, causal inference with a survey outcome, shrinkage and regularization, designing and analyzing longitudinal panel surveys, behavioral data analysis)']

job_title: Research Scientist, 3D Computer Vision  &  State Estimation (PhD)
job_text: ['', 'Broad understanding of the full machine vision pipeline from sensors to high-level algorithms.', 'Experience working in a Linux environment.', '5+ years C++ experience with a mastery of modern C++ features.', 'Background in advanced geometric computer vision, including tracking, SLAM, visual-inertial odometry, sensor/display calibration, large-scale structure from motion or relocalization technologies.', 'Experience with SLAM systems e.g. monocular, stereo, visual-inertial or RGBD.Background in optics or computational imaging.Experience working in a Linux environment.Experience in GPU programming such as CUDA.Broad understanding of the full machine vision pipeline from sensors to high-level algorithms.Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at leading workshops or conferences such as CVPR, ECCV/ICCV, BMVC, or SIGGRAPH.Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, coding competitions, or widely used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub.).', 'Experience understanding, developing, and analyzing complex systems.', 'Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration.', 'Mathematical background and understanding of numerical optimization, linear algebra, probabilistic estimation and 3D geometry.', 'Analyze and improve efficiency, accuracy, scalability, and stability of currently deployed systems.', 'Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, coding competitions, or widely used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub.).', 'Experience with SLAM systems e.g. monocular, stereo, visual-inertial or RGBD.', 'Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD in the field of computer vision, robotics or equivalent.Background in advanced geometric computer vision, including tracking, SLAM, visual-inertial odometry, sensor/display calibration, large-scale structure from motion or relocalization technologies.Mathematical background and understanding of numerical optimization, linear algebra, probabilistic estimation and 3D geometry.5+ years C++ experience with a mastery of modern C++ features.Experience understanding, developing, and analyzing complex systems.Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration.Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.', 'Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at leading workshops or conferences such as CVPR, ECCV/ICCV, BMVC, or SIGGRAPH.', 'Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD in the field of computer vision, robotics or equivalent.', 'Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.', 'Research, develop and prototype advanced tightly integrated hardware and software technologies in the domain of tracking, 3D reconstruction, localization, SfM, calibration automation etc.', 'Background in optics or computational imaging.', 'Collaborate with team members throughout the lifetime of a project, from prototyping to deployed products.', 'Deliver research results that have a direct impact on Facebook and Oculus products.', 'Experience in GPU programming such as CUDA.', 'Research, develop and prototype advanced tightly integrated hardware and software technologies in the domain of tracking, 3D reconstruction, localization, SfM, calibration automation etc.Analyze and improve efficiency, accuracy, scalability, and stability of currently deployed systems.Collaborate with team members throughout the lifetime of a project, from prototyping to deployed products.Deliver research results that have a direct impact on Facebook and Oculus products.']

internship/co-op', "Experience mentoring other researchers and maintain our team's standard of work", 'Orchestrate strategic visioning and analytical activity, moving between macro trends and micro trends in privacy and data use, and developing substantiated point of viewsWork closely with product teams, as well as other researchers, to identify important research questionsAct as a thought
